docs.snippet: Finland last week seemed to be facing major military and diplomatic dilemmas. A nation of less than 4,000,000 people, its limited manpower had suffered heavy losses in two wars waged with Russia since 1939 and it had grown increasingly dependent upon...
docs.lead_paragraph: Finland last week seemed to be facing major military and diplomatic dilemmas. A nation of less than 4,000,000 people, its limited manpower had suffered heavy losses in two wars waged with Russia since 1939 and it had grown increasingly dependent upon Nazi Germany for foodstuffs and munitions.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 4 (Delayed) -- The Chilean Government's recognition of the Argentine regime of Gen. Edelmiro Farrell was received with joy today in official circles, who regard it as destroying any possibility that the American republics may...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 4 (Delayed) -- The Chilean Government's recognition of the Argentine regime of Gen. Edelmiro Farrell was received with joy today in official circles, who regard it as destroying any possibility that the American republics may present a united front toward Argentina in the same way as they did toward Bolivia last January.

headline.main: BUENOS AIRES SEES PAN-AMERICAN RIFT; Argentina Is Hopeful Uruguay and Paraguay Will Recognize Regime, Shun U.S. Example BUENOS AIRES SEES PAN-AMERICAN RIFT

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESIBy Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: A slightly easier tone in the Canadian free dollar, and a sharp break in the Argentina peso on Saturday, represented the only change of importance registered in the trading in foreign exchanges last week. All other currencies were firm.
docs.lead_paragraph: A slightly easier tone in the Canadian free dollar, and a sharp break in the Argentina peso on Saturday, represented the only change of importance registered in the trading in foreign exchanges last week. All other currencies were firm.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MARCH 4, 1944

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 5 (AP) -- Jarred by Washington's "wait and see" policy, the Argentine Government of Gen. Edelmiro Farrell centered its attention today upon its neighbors, Uruguay and Paraguay, where there was a possibility of action...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 5 (AP) -- Jarred by Washington's "wait and see" policy, the Argentine Government of Gen. Edelmiro Farrell centered its attention today upon its neighbors, Uruguay and Paraguay, where there was a possibility of action independent of the United States.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 6 (AP) -- Uruguay temporarily withheld today her decision whether she will recognize the Argentine Government of Gen. Edelmiro Farrell, a Foreign Office informant said. This virtually meant a suspension of diplomatic...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 6 (AP) -- Uruguay temporarily withheld today her decision whether she will recognize the Argentine Government of Gen. Edelmiro Farrell, a Foreign Office informant said. This virtually meant a suspension of diplomatic relations with Argentina.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 6 -- Hopes are held here that Uruguay and Paraguay will withhold recognition from the Farrell government in Argentina and that Chile will be found to have been the only Government to break the inter-American bloc by extending...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 6 -- Hopes are held here that Uruguay and Paraguay will withhold recognition from the Farrell government in Argentina and that Chile will be found to have been the only Government to break the inter-American bloc by extending recognition in the present status of affairs.

headline.main: CAPITAL HOPEFUL OF AMERICAS' UNITY; Resolution Opposing Recognition of Argentine Regime Voted by Uruguay Chamber Washington Hopes to Keep Unity Of Americas on Argentine Issue

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 7 -- Argentina is exerting considerable pressure on the Governments of neighboring countries to forbid transmission of news unfavorable to Argentina. The Buenos Aires Government is trying to invoke an agreement concluded...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 7 -- Argentina is exerting considerable pressure on the Governments of neighboring countries to forbid transmission of news unfavorable to Argentina. The Buenos Aires Government is trying to invoke an agreement concluded some years ago between various South American countries, whereby each undertook, as a measure for American solidarity, to prevent the transmission of news hostile to the others.
docs.abstract: govt presses neighboring countries to forbid transmission of news unfavorable to new regime; Salvador bars recognition

headline.main: ARGENTINA SEEKS TIGHTER NEWS GAG; Presses Neighbors to Shut Off Reports Unfavorable to Buenos Aires Regime
